intro: Agathisanthemum assimile, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant features showy yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers, creating a striking appearance. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight, making it a popular choice for gardens. Agathisanthemum assimile is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
